intro: Balfourina mexicana, commonly known as Mexican balfourina, is a species of flowering plant in the family Polygonaceae. It is a perennial shrub that typically grows in arid and semi-arid regions of Mexico. The plant has simple, alternate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, and it produces small, clustered flowers with five petals. It is adapted to survive in harsh environments with limited water availability. Balfourina mexicana is sometimes used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
